params.text: Zones are heterogenous blockchains carrying out the authentication of accounts and transactions, the creation and distribution of tokens, and the execution of changes to the chain.

Hubs connect these so-called zones. Hubs are blockchains designed to connect heterogenous blockchains, i.e. zones. Once a zone connects to a hub through an IBC connection, it gets automatic access to the other zones connected to the hub. At this point, data and value can be sent and received between the zones without risk of, for instance, double-spending tokens. This helps reduce the number of chain-to-chain connections that need to be established for interoperability.
